com.group4.ist412.icare412

Class HTTPServer.Headers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.group4.ist412.icare412.HTTPServer.Headers
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<HTTPServer.Header>
    Enclosing class:
    HTTPServer

    public static class HTTPServer.Headers
extends Object
implements Iterable<HTTPServer.Header>
    The Headers class encapsulates a collection of HTTP headers. Header names are treated case-insensitively, although this class retains their original case. Header insertion order is maintained as well.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      protected HTTPServer.Header[] headers

      void add(String name, String value)
      Adds a header with the given name and value to the end of this collection of headers.
      void addAll(HTTPServer.Headers headers)
      Adds all given headers to the end of this collection of headers, in their original order.
      boolean contains(String name)
      Returns whether there exists a header with the given name.
      String get(String name)
      Returns the value of the first header with the given name.
      Date getDate(String name)
      Returns the Date value of the header with the given name.
      Map<String,String> getParams(String name)
      Returns a header's parameters.
      Iterator<HTTPServer.Header> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the headers, in their insertion order.
      void remove(String name)
      Removes all headers with the given name (if any exist).
      HTTPServer.Header replace(String name, String value)
      Adds a header with the given name and value, replacing the first existing header with the same name.
      int size()
      Returns the number of added headers.
      void writeTo(OutputStream out)
      Writes the headers to the given stream (including trailing CRLF).

        public int size()
        Returns the number of added headers.
        Returns:

      • get

        public String get(String name)
        Returns the value of the first header with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        the header value, or null if none exists

      • getDate

        public Date getDate(String name)
        Returns the Date value of the header with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        the header value as a Date, or null if none exists or if the value is not in any supported date format

      • contains

        public boolean contains(String name)
        Returns whether there exists a header with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        whether there exists a header with the given name

      • add

        public void add(String name,
                String value)
        Adds a header with the given name and value to the end of this collection of headers. Leading and trailing whitespace are trimmed.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name (case insensitive)
        value - the header value

      • addAll

        public void addAll(HTTPServer.Headers headers)
        Adds all given headers to the end of this collection of headers, in their original order.
        Parameters:
        headers - the headers to add

      • replace

        public HTTPServer.Header replace(String name,
                                 String value)
        Adds a header with the given name and value, replacing the first existing header with the same name. If there is no existing header with the same name, it is added as in add(java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        name - the header name (case insensitive)
        value - the header value
        Returns:
        the replaced header, or null if none existed

      • remove

        public void remove(String name)
        Removes all headers with the given name (if any exist).
        Parameters:
        name - the header name (case insensitive)

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(OutputStream out)
             throws IOException
        Writes the headers to the given stream (including trailing CRLF).
        Parameters:
        out - the stream to write the headers to
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • getParams

        public Map<String,String> getParams(String name)
        Returns a header's parameters. Parameter order is maintained, and the first key (in iteration order) is the header's value without the parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        the header's parameter names and values

      • iterator

        public Iterator<HTTPServer.Header> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the headers, in their insertion order. If the headers collection is modified during iteration, the iteration result is undefined. The remove operation is unsupported.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<HTTPServer.Header>
        Returns:
        an Iterator over the headers
